blogData.content: You all know I love antique glass. I always shop with a UV light in hand to help me detect Uranium and Manganese in the glass. During the 1800's, glassmakers didn't have access to clean sand and to brighten or clarify glass, manganese was added. Around 1915, makers stopped using Manganese. When searching for old glass in the wild, it will look clear yet glow green under a black light. Buy it!!!
